ch.ecma.csta.callcontrol

Interface TR87CallControlListener

  • All Superinterfaces:
    CallControlListener, java.util.EventListener, LogicalDeviceFeatureListener

    public interface TR87CallControlListener
extends java.util.EventListener, CallControlListener, LogicalDeviceFeatureListener
    Initiates an event monitor on a specified device's call control and logical device feature events. This event monitor is created to support TR87 client only. The supported CSTA events include:
    • ConferencedEvent
    • ConnectionClearedEvent
    • DeliveredEvent
    • DivertedEvent
    • EstablishedEvent
    • FailedEvent
    • HeldEvent
    • OriginatedEvent
    • RetrievedEvent
    • TransferedEvent
    • DoNotDisturbEvent
    • ForwardingEvent

    Note that not all of the parameters for any given event may be supported. In these cases, the event description will contain a table of the parameters that are supported.

    Java listeners are used to implement the CSTA concept called monitoring.

    Add a listener to a device using the MonitoringServices.addCallControlListener method. To learn more about using listeners with this API, see Using Listeners in the Device, Media & Call Control (DMCC) API.

    Version:
    4.1
    Author:
    AVAYA, Inc.

      • Methods inherited from interface ch.ecma.csta.logical.LogicalDeviceFeatureListener
